package prob;

import java.io.BufferedReader;
import java.io.BufferedWriter;
import java.io.FileReader;
import java.io.FileWriter;
import java.io.IOException;
import java.text.DecimalFormat;

public class Main {
	
	private static final String FILE = "C:\\Users\\Chiefan\\Documents\\prob2.txt";

	public static void main(String[] args) {
		// TODO Auto-generated method stub
		
		// Setting fline string for first line. 
		
		String fline = null;
		
		// Reading input file for data.
		
		try (BufferedReader br = new BufferedReader(new FileReader("C:\\Users\\Chiefan\\Documents\\prob1.txt"))) {
			String cline;
			fline = br.readLine();
			
		// Setting number of cases.
			
			int tt = Integer.parseInt(fline);
			
		// For loop to read lines up to the number of cases mentioned above.
			
			for (int i=1; i<=tt; i++) {
				
				cline = br.readLine();
				
		// Sending data to check() method to calculate and write the returned value to the output file.
				
				try (BufferedWriter bw = new BufferedWriter(new FileWriter(FILE, true))) {
					bw.write(Integer.toString(i) + ". " + check(cline));
					bw.newLine();
					
				}
					catch (IOException e) {
						
						e.printStackTrace();
				
				}

			}
				}
		catch (IOException e4) {
			e4.printStackTrace();
		}
		}
	
	// check() method to calculate the probability and percentage of each case.
	
	public static String check(String num) {
		String[] all = num.split("\\s+");
		double x = Double.parseDouble(all[0]);
		double y = Double.parseDouble(all[1]);
		long z = Long.parseLong(all[2]);
		double t = x - y;
		double prb = Math.pow(10, t);
		double chance = (z / prb) * 100;
		DecimalFormat round = new DecimalFormat("######0.00");
		
		
		if (z == 0 && x != y) { 
			return "0.00%";
		}
		else if (x == y) {
			return "100.00%";
		}
		else {
			
			return round.format(chance) + "%";
		}

	}

}
